questions.question: Which pair of logic gates are considered "universal gates" because any other Boolean function can be implemented using only gates of that type?
options: AND and OR gates
XOR and XNOR gates
NAND and NOR gates
BUFFER and INVERTER gates
FLIP-FLOP and LATCH

questions.question: In the physical design phase of an Integrated Circuit (IC), what is the primary purpose of 'floorplanning'?
options: Defining the exact routing paths for all signals to connect blocks and pins.
Verifying that the design adheres to manufacturing rules like minimum width and spacing.
Optimizing logic gates and flip-flops for area and speed after RTL synthesis.
Determining the approximate size, shape, and relative placement of major functional blocks.
Generating optimized clock distribution networks to minimize clock skew and latency.

questions.question: In a virtual memory system, what is the primary role of a 'page table'?
options: To store frequently accessed data for faster retrieval by the CPU.
To translate virtual addresses generated by the CPU into physical addresses in main memory.
To manage the order of instruction execution and resolve data dependencies.
To store temporary data for function calls and local variables.
To control direct memory access operations, transferring data without CPU intervention.

questions.question: In an out-of-order execution processor, what is the primary function of the 'Reorder Buffer' (ROB)?
options: To hold instructions that are waiting for their input operands to become available before execution.
To store the results of speculative execution until they can be committed to architectural state in program order.
To translate complex instructions from the Instruction Set Architecture into simpler micro-operations.
To predict the outcome of conditional branches to avoid pipeline stalls.
To manage the allocation and deallocation of physical registers for register renaming.

questions.question: In advanced semiconductor manufacturing, what does "Process-Voltage-Temperature (PVT) variation" primarily refer to in the context of IC design?
options: Changes in transistor gate length and width due to variations in photolithography and etching processes.
The combined impact of manufacturing process deviations, supply voltage fluctuations, and operating temperature changes on circuit performance and reliability.
Variations in the threshold voltage of transistors due to random dopant fluctuations and oxide thickness differences.
The effect of ambient temperature on the electrical resistance of metal interconnects and their current carrying capacity.
The phenomenon where the power consumption of an IC varies significantly with workload and operating clock frequency.
